sections.title: State Overview
paragraphs:
Acre is located in the North region of Brazil with its capital in Rio Branco.
With a population of 906,000, Acre offers a unique blend of
opportunities and lifestyle experiences. The state is characterized by its Forestry, Sustainable Agriculture, Rubber Production
and is known for being Very welcoming, lower cost of living.

Climate:
Tropical - Hot and humid year-round, rainy season June-August
Temperature Range:
20-32¬∞C throughout the year
Average Monthly Salary:
R$ 2,500-5,500 average monthly salary

sections.title: Major Cities
paragraphs: Discover the main urban centers in Acre:
Rio Branco (capital, 320k people)
Cruzeiro do Sul (120k people)
Sena Madureira

sections.title: Economy & Employment
paragraphs:
Acre's economy is built on Forestry, Sustainable Agriculture, Rubber Production. The state offers significant opportunities
for both local and international professionals seeking employment and business ventures.
Traditional rubber production with modern sustainable practices
Growing forestry sector with eco-tourism opportunities
Agricultural exports including nuts and fruits
Handicrafts and artisan products
Forestry and sustainable development
Eco-tourism and hospitality
Agriculture and agribusiness
Government and education

Employment Outlook:
Acre presents strong opportunities across multiple sectors,
with salaries ranging from R$ 2,500-5,500 average monthly salary for average positions.

sections.title: Education & Universities
paragraphs:
Acre boasts several excellent universities and educational institutions, making it ideal for
students and families seeking quality education.
Federal University of Acre (UFAC)
State University of Acre (UEAC)

Education Options:
From public universities to private institutions, Acre offers
diverse educational opportunities. Many universities offer programs in English for international students.

sections.title: Cost of Living & Housing
paragraphs: Low to Moderate - Most affordable in the North region

1-Bedroom Apartment:
R$ 1,200-2,500 for 1-bedroom apartment
This varies depending on location - central areas are more expensive, while suburbs offer better value.

sections.title: Healthcare System
paragraphs:
Public Healthcare (SUS):
Available to all residents, including immigrants
Private Healthcare:
Mix of public (SUS) and private hospitals
Universal health system (SUS) coverage
Quality private hospitals and clinics

sections.title: üöó Transportation

Air (TAP flights), river transport, highway BR-364
Public transportation (buses, metro where available)

sections.title: Culture & Main Attractions
paragraphs:
Acre is known for Amazonian cuisine - fish, fruits, indigenous ingredients.
The state offers numerous attractions and cultural experiences for residents and visitors.

Acre is famous for:
Amazonian cuisine - fish, fruits, indigenous ingredients
Amazon rainforest exploration
Rubber tapping tours
Wildlife and bird watching
Indigenous culture experiences

sections.title: What Makes Acre Special
paragraphs: Gateway to the Amazon rainforest
Unique biodiversity hotspot
Strong indigenous culture
Eco-tourism pioneer in Brazil

sections.title: üåô Nightlife & Entertainment
paragraphs:
Acre offers:
Casual, local bars and restaurants, beach culture
Bars and clubs in major cities
Live music venues and cultural shows
Restaurants and dining experiences
Beach activities and water sports
Cultural festivals and events

sections.title: Immigration & Expat Tips
paragraphs: Learn Portuguese - essential for integration and employment
Register with local authorities within required timeframe
Open a bank account early - necessary for housing and employment
Get a CPF (tax ID) - required for most transactions
Explore neighborhoods before committing to housing
Join expat groups for support and networking
Budget accordingly based on your lifestyle
Familiarize yourself with local customs and culture
Keep important documents organized
Stay updated on visa requirements and renewals

sections.title: State-specific context
paragraphs: Acre has a distinct economic and administrative profile. Most immigration registrations occur in Rio Branco, and access can vary by city.

sections.title: Decision support
